criteria: Identification of Key Features from Graphs and Tables
Interpretation of Key Features in Context
descriptions: Student is unable to identify any key features (intercepts, increasing/decreasing intervals, etc.) from graphs or tables.
Student can identify one or two key features with significant errors or omissions.
Student can identify some key features, but demonstrates misunderstanding or misses important details.
Student accurately identifies most key features from graphs and tables, but may have minor omissions or errors.
Student accurately and thoroughly identifies all key features from graphs and tables with only minor imperfections.
Student flawlessly identifies and explains all key features from graphs and tables, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding.
Student provides no interpretation of the key features in the context of the problem.
Student attempts to interpret key features but interpretations are nonsensical or completely detached from the context.
Student offers basic interpretations of some key features, but struggles to connect them to the context or makes significant errors.
Student interprets most key features in the context of the problem with reasonable accuracy, but may lack depth or precision.
Student effectively interprets key features in the context of the problem, demonstrating a good understanding of the relationship between the quantities.
Student provides insightful and nuanced interpretations of key features, demonstrating a deep and thorough understanding of the context and the relationships between quantities.
Student is unable to sketch a graph from the verbal description or produces a graph that bears no resemblance to the description.
Student attempts to sketch a graph, but the result is largely inaccurate, missing key features or misrepresenting the relationship.
Student sketches a graph that captures some of the key features from the description, but makes significant errors in shape, scale, or other important details.
Student sketches a graph that generally represents the verbal description accurately, but may have minor imperfections or omissions.
Student accurately sketches a graph that includes all key features described verbally, demonstrating a strong understanding of the relationship.
Student skillfully sketches a graph that perfectly represents the verbal description, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of the relationship with precise detail.
